caption:
This photograph captures two goldfish in a body of water, viewed from above. The left fish is vividly colored in shades of gold and orange, with a shiny, scaly texture that reflects light. It appears lively and is swimming through the water. The right fish, on the other hand, appears pale and is facing upwards towards the waterâ€™s surface, suggesting it might be deceased or unwell due to its color and lack of movement.

The background of the image is a dark, murky aqua environment that suggests either a pond or a very stagnant section of a larger water body. The bottom surface beneath the water appears uneven and rocky, contributing to the overall natural and somewhat somber setting of the scene. The lighting is subdued, casting a gloomy ambiance over the image, highlighting the contrast between the vibrant life of the healthy fish and the stillness of the pale one.
title: Major fish kill on the olentangy was caused by chemicals from the pennwalt corporation storage building, which was desTroyed by fire and explosions june 20, 1974.  The damage was believed caused by lightning hitting the structure.  Chemicals were washed half a mile down the storm drain, and killed fish for four miles downstream.  Epa authorities supervised the cleanup
